pr_title: Auto Query Fixer: Implement UnrecognizedColumnFixer and FunctionNotFoundFixer

timeline.bodyText:
why we want this flag? What if we are not confident？
Maybe give confidence level instead of boolean?
timeline.author: kikkyo

replies.bodyText: The confident flag is used when the program is in user-assistance mode. Usually, the program only asks users to select an option if multiple ones exist. However, if an approach is marked not confident, then the program will ask users to confirm the option even if only one option exists.
replies.author: mingen-pan

replies.bodyText: ok. How do we know if we are confident or not?
replies.author: kikkyo

replies.bodyText:
Currently, it is determined by developers. For example, fixing the unrecognized column is confident, because the column to replace is the most similar column to the incorrect one.
However, fixing some syntax error could be not confident. One case is "Expect End of Input but got others". Most unparsable query will result in this error, but this error message contains no useful information. Thus, there is no way to fix this error in a confident way. In this situation, the query fixer will mark this fix as "not confident".
replies.author: mingen-pan

timeline.bodyText: Does this mean if the 'dry-run' error message doesn't provide similar function suggestions we will return error?
timeline.author: kikkyo

replies.bodyText: For built-in function, yes. However, if the function is UDF, then logic will be implemented in future, like querying the server to find the UDF with similar names.
replies.author: mingen-pan

replies.bodyText: OK. Please document the behavior somewhere so we know what to expect :).
replies.author: kikkyo

replies.bodyText: Yes, a TODO is put in the code. I will document this logic once it is implemented.
replies.author: mingen-pan

timeline.author: kikkyo
kikkyo
kikkyo

replies.bodyText: Rephrase to "The detail of why the query fails to be fixed.".
replies.author: mingen-pan

timeline.author: kikkyo

timeline.bodyText: Do we find similar function using edit distance too or other algo?
timeline.author: kikkyo

replies.bodyText: Yes, the similarity is based on edit distance. Currently, we only consider the similarity in function names. It is hard to examine whether the function has a valid signature.
replies.author: mingen-pan

timeline.bodyText: 'Replace the function'? since we are using a new function instead
timeline.author: kikkyo

timeline.bodyText:
We should add more test cases for each error type, consider using parameterized tests or file-based test. We need to test more complicated queries.
Feel free to add TODO and add it later.
timeline.author: kikkyo
